name: Club Magic Life Sharm el Sheikh Imperial

reviews.title: Exceeded All Expectations
reviews.text: Just returned on 18th December 2011 from a one week break to this hotel.

reviews.title: Just book it!
reviews.text: Hotel check in was quick efficient and friendly. We stayed in block 10 and had a sea view which was fantastic. The room was clean and of a decent size. Due the energy efficient light bulbs the main room was dark but the bathroom was bright enough to put your make up on in there. Rooms were kept clean and tidy and would return from a day on the beach to a beautiful towel display.

reviews.title: Don't hesitate go!
reviews.text: This hotel really is ALL Inclusive, so you never need to wander around with cash or cards on you. The cocktails are fantastic and the wine and beers not watered down.

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: When we went to the hotel was only 1/3 full, so it felt like we were in a really exclusive hotel. The waiters were all quick, efficeint and friendly and went out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. There was never any pressure to give them tips.

reviews.title: Miles Better than we expected
reviews.text: The beach bar was really chilled out in the day and the life guard was excellent at cleaning any sand from your tables and sunbeds.

reviews.title: I love this place!
reviews.text: Just to add to Fluffymamma's review below, which is everything I wanted to say, but she beat me to it...........

reviews.title: best ever
reviews.text: The Margueritas at the pool, and the cocktails in the Wunderbar were superb.

reviews.title: Magic Indeed!!
reviews.text: And a big thankyou to Serdal (Guest Svcs) and Gurkan (Ents) and all your teams....you made the weekend very special for all of us!

reviews.title: Fantastic value and outstanding service
reviews.text: Oh, and the dive centre was really excellent. Good, new equipment, Nitrox and plenty of sites to keep you busy. I can thouroughly recommend the boat trips. Lots to see, and not a shark in sight!

reviews.title: REST AND RELAXATION
reviews.text: We'll be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just arrived back this morning from our second stay at this hotel. We had a fabulous week! We were given cool towels and a welcome drink on arrival, our paperwork and passports were processed in a matter of minutes, we were then taken to our room on one of the hotel buggies. On our previous stay we paid extra for a pool view room but the gardens are so lovely that in all honesty its not really worth paying the extra for so we didn't bother this time.
reviews.title: Fantastic time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very spacious with a little seating area. The bathrooms are large and very clean if a little tired looking. I had a birthday while we were there are the cleaner made me a fantastic towel birthday cake complete with towel candle & flower decorations!
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food wise, I'm a fussy vegetarian but on the whole found there was plenty to chose from. At some meals various foods were labelled as vegetarian and/or spicy which I found reassuring but this didn't always seem to happen. We didn't eat in any of the speciality restaurants so I can't comment on those.
reviews.title: Shame about the food....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the service in general to be quicker than on our previous visit which was in April. Alot of the bar staff are very good but I must give a special mention to Omar in the Eagles Bar.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As other reviewers have said, there are 2 pools, we spent most of our time by the relax pool, be aware the pool is very cold!! There were always plenty of loungers but at this time of year the majority of them were in the shade by 2-2.30pm and the sun is gone completely by 4-4.30. On windy days its quite cool in the shade. We found if we were by the pool by 8.30 or so we could get a lounger that kept the sun for as much of the day as possible, these are the loungers at the pool bar end.
reviews.title: as all inclusives go this hotel has got it spot on

reviews.text: Arrived on the 15th December for 11 nights over the festive period with my husband and 2 teenage children. We all had a wonderful time. We avoided the activity pool as after a couple of days it began to get very busy and noisy with all the activities taking place, but if you enjoy party games, water-polo ect then maybe this pool is the place for you. You also get the Wellness spa team trying to persuade you to have treatments, more on that later. We moved over to the relax pool, this was more to our liking as it was quiet and had amazing service. Everyone from the waiters to the pool lifeguard were so pleasant and helpful. We were offered drinks regularly and you couldn't fault the service.
reviews.title: A nice winter warmer

reviews.text: Food and beverage: could not believe earlier comments about F&B lack of choice. There was all you could want for breakfast, cereals, toast, fruit, omelets, pastries, croissants and cold meats etc. Evening meals had a huge choice and the food was constantly being freshly cooked at each station. Drinks were plentiful, the local wine was surprisingly good and available by the bottle should you so desire.
reviews.title: Hidden treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at all three a la carte restaurants and found them excellent, great to have waiter service for a couple of nights.
reviews.title: Going down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the Christmas eve gala dinner the hotel made an extra effort with food and decorations. We all enjoyed the evening nativity show with real camels, donkey and goats with carols at the end.
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather: during the day it was around 24c. We managed to eat outside on all but three of the evenings as it did get cold and windy.
reviews.title: Absolutely Magic

aka: Club Magic Life Sharm El Sheikh Imperial Hotel
